Technique of logging in as a customer to allow developers to test and troubleshoot from the customers perspective. Current implementation spoof user is not useful for ads and shop links.

Technique of logging in as a customer to allow developers to test and troubleshoot from the customers perspective. New eLogin implementation should replace spoof user to support testing ads and shop links.

NavigationStack is a container that manages a stack-based navigation flow, allowing users to push and pop views in a hierarchical interface, replacing the now-deprecated NavigationView. Precondition is AppStart in SwiftUI.

A simulated backend server used during development and testing to mimic the behavior of real APIs or services. It allows developers to test frontend components or integrations without needing the actual backend to be available, ensuring faster and isolated testing.

An agile framework for managing and completing complex projects, typically software development. It emphasizes iterative progress through sprints, collaboration within cross-functional teams, and continuous improvement through regular reviews and retrospectives. Key roles include the Scrum Master, Product Owner, and Development Team.

A library for iOS that simplifies working with NSAttributedString by providing utilities for styling and manipulating text, including features like clickable links, text highlighting, and more advanced text formatting options. Not maintained since 2016 and can be replaced by Nantes.
An open-source library for iOS that provides a customizable, high-performance carousel-style interface. Not maintained since 2016.
A simple and customizable floating action button (FAB) library for iOS. Not maintained since 2019 and error prone.
A modern, asynchronous Android data storage solution that replaces SharedPreferences for storing key-value pairs or typed objects with improved reliability.
A testing method where screenshots of an app's UI are captured and compared against baseline images to detect visual changes or regressions in the user interface across different devices or states.
